sect1.title: #EXPORT

row.entry: The name of a previously declared template variable.
The name of a field, RECORD structure, or dataset.

sect1.para: The #EXPORT #EXPORT statement produces XML text from the specified data and places it in the symbol. This allows the LOADXML(symbol,name) form to instantiate an XML scope on the information from the data to process.
The XML output is generated with the following format:
sect1.programlisting: <Data> <Field label="<label-of-field>" name="<name-of-field>" position="<n>" rawtype="<n>" size="<n>" type="<ecl-type-without-size>" /> ... </Data>
sect1.para: IFBLOCKs are simply expanded out in the XML. Nested RECORD types have an isRecord attribute that is set to 1, and are followed by the fields they contain, and then a Field tag with no name and the isEnd attribute set to 1. This representation is used rather than nested objects so it can be processed by a #FOR statement. Child dataset types are also expanded out in a similar way, and have an isDataset attribute set to 1 on the field.
